description: Harmonic mean of digits is an integer.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: 1236 is a term as the harmonic mean is 4/(1+1/2+1/3+1/6) = 2.
mathematica: Do[ h = IntegerDigits[n]; If[ Sort[h] [[1]] != 0 && IntegerQ[ Length[h] / Apply[ Plus, 1/h] ], Print[n]], {n, 1, 10^4} ] Note that the number of entries <= 10^n are 9, 22, 61, 198, 927, 4738, 24620, 130093,hmdiQ[n_]:=DigitCount[n,10,0]==0&&IntegerQ[HarmonicMean[ IntegerDigits[ n]]]; Select[Range[1000],hmdiQ] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Sep 22 2012 *)
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jun 12 2001
extensions: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 08 2001
